item.title: Data structure - Disjoint Set
item.description: Source code Disjoint Set A disjoint set is a data structure that stores a collection of non-overlapping sets. It supports the following operations: makeSet(x) - makes new set \( \{x\} \); union(x,y) - merges two sets \( \{x\} \) and \( \{y\} \); find(x) - finds a representative member of a set. If \( x \) and \( y \) lie in the same set, then find(x) = find(y), otherwise find(x) !
